notes: GVM: In the text, the accent/apostrophe is over the hyphen. The closest I could transcribe it is -́i-, and from what I understand, it depicts a shortening of a previous long vowel if the morpheme -́i- attaches to it; essentially, the ' is an orthographic representation of a shortening process that occurs where certain vowel lengths and qualities come together...
